direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods navigate sibling elements but in opposite directions (next vs. previous).
Both methods involve navigating sibling elements, but firstElementSibling() finds the first sibling element.
Both methods involve navigating sibling elements, but lastElementSibling() finds the last sibling element.
Both methods involve navigating sibling elements, but nextElementSiblings() collects all subsequent sibling elements.
Both methods involve navigating sibling elements, but previousElementSiblings() collects all preceding sibling elements.
Both methods involve navigating elements within the same parent, but child(int) accesses a specific child by index.
Both methods depend on the parent element to navigate siblings or children.
Both methods involve accessing child elements, but children() returns all child elements.
Both methods involve accessing sibling elements, but siblingElements() returns all sibling elements.
Both methods involve navigating sibling elements, but elementSiblingIndex() returns the index of the current element among its siblings.
